alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 08 at 12:38PM PST until November 08 at 3:45PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 237 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Diego. * WHEN...Until 237 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas in metro San Diego. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1238 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.1 and 0.25 inches of rain have fallen. Urban flooding low lying areas. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches in 90 minutes are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chula Vista, El Cajon, National City, La Mesa, Poway, Imperial Beach, Ramona, Coronado, Alpine and Tierrasanta. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
